page.title: 12Worcestershire Hunt Kennels
page.content: The Worcestershire Hunt moved to Fernhill Heath in 1806. The buildings include lodges, stables, tack rooms, flesh shed and the Long Room which is used for meetings. There are also houses for the hunt staff. Cub-hunting occurs from September to November when fox hunting starts. The season finishes in March, depending on the weather and local farming policies. Sixty couple of hounds are kept, divided into dog and bitch packs. They are exercised twice daily by hunt staff either on bicyles or horseback. They are fed once a day. Carcasses are prepared for the hounds by the hunt staff on the premises. Puppies are sent to farms to be 'walked' at 10 weeks and start hunting at eighteen months. Hunting is threatened by pressure groups and modern farming methods, housing and new roads.
